p: The collected plant leaves were washed by running tap water to remove adhered epiphytes and soil debris. After drying under sterile conditions, the surfaces were sterilized by subsequentially soaking them in the following solutions: sterile distilled H 2O for 1 min, 70% ( v/ v) ethanol for 1 min, sodium hypochlorite solution (2.5%) for 4 min, and 70% ( v/ v) ethanol for 30 s, and finally the surface-sterilized tissues were washed thrice with sterile distilled water. The last washing water was plated onto fungal, bacterial, and actinomycete culture media of Czapek Dox agar, nutrient agar (NA), and starch nitrate agar, respectively. The surface sterilization was confirmed by the absence of any microbial growth onto the previous cultural media [ 46, 70].
